content:
Posted: January 6, 2014
												Surprisingly fun little game.At this point, I practically detest zombie games.  Too much Killing Floor/Left 4 Dead, I suppose. (YES I KNOW THE ZEDS TECHNICALLY AREN'T ZOMBIES, SHUTUP.)  If H2S had been a simple isometric zombie shooter, I might have said "pass" and not given it a second glance.  But what makes the game fun is the survival elements, and the fact that you have a simple crafting system.The game has a lot of small-time developer charm.  It feels like a game created by a small studio with limited budget, and it's full of ideas that sound great on paper but which didn't quite work together in the finished product.  For example, as part of the survival mechanic you must eat, drink, and sleep.  And this is a real concern when you first start the game.  Finding fresh water or something to eat isn't easy.  But once you've gained your first set of weapons and gathered a bit of food, then survival will just boil down to you versus the zombies.  Only sleeping becomes a factor, and that's just because you can't sleep whenever you want to.The build mechanic is fun, but it lacks refinement.  In particular, you will find way more individual crafting components than you need, and so inventory management becomes a signficant problem later in the game.  So you will spend a lot of time juggling items between islands (in story mode) in order to satisfy requirements to build rare items.However, I stopped doing crafting once I realized that one weapon in the game is vastly over-powered, and does not require ammo.  So, like the survival mechanic, the usefulness of crafting wanes later in the game.Yet, despite this, I still recommend the game.  I think it's well worth the price.  Even if they didn't change the tutorial videos from the Xbox 360 version.  ("Press (A) to kill a zombie!")It has a multiplayer mode, though as of yet you cannot do online co-op for the story mode;  You have to play pre-defined challenges, which are fun but only give you small slices of things to accomplish.  The only real complaint I have about co-op is that the game forces you to "share" a camera.  So it is impossible for you to run ahead of your friend or explore different areas at the same time.  That's rather stifling, and in story mode this is going to be REAL annoying since you must travel between different islands.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												I've recently been playing Diablo 3 on console, and have finally been graced with the funds to purchase a decent PC. As a complete n00b to Steam, I saw an advert for this game, and I have to say it was quite a deal.90% off.Meaning, I would have to spend two whole dollars on this game. I didn't have but $15 left in my account to last me for the week.And damn am I glad I did.I've been entertained from the start. The zombies are, well... zombies. Some fast, some slow, big fat ugly ones and sneaky little buggers too. Rarely do I find myself feeling uncomfortable whilst playing a game. Uncomfortable in the sense of "I don't want to complete x mission because it just got dark and I really don't think it's a good idea to go wandering out in the fog right now".This one nails it.There is always a pressing desire to get enough food, find sleeping/safe areas, and make sure the Jerry cans are filled with water, Survival and quick thinking is absolute key for this game; thirst, hunger, sleep and health all play exponentially important parts in this ever-surprising Diablo-style slash-n-hack, craft-yer-guts-out game.12/10 would download again (even at full price).

content:
Posted: September 1, 2014
												I really like this game, but it crashes frequently which ruins it.  I finished it in about 20 hours.  It's got zombies which I'm heavily biased towards.  Interesting crafting.  Descent story.  Descent graphics.  As I summarized, this would probably be an 8/10 for me if it weren't for the rampant stability issue.  I give it a 5/10 because of the frequent crashes.  Save points are in the shelters which I found myself having to visit intentionally so I wouldn't loose progress in the game from a crash.  The crashes are most likely video card/driver related I seem to have lessened them by dropping the resolution of the game below my native monitor's resolution.  I'm sure the console versions were just fine, and this is just a poor port to PC.  The build I played and finished was from May 2014.  I doubt the dev studio is going to sink much more effort into support.  So don't spend any real money on this.

												Played this once... tried to play it again. I couldn't and I just can't pick it back up now.The crafting takes a while, you have to discover the recipes and if your not a dirty lil cheater with a browser containing a wiki recipes list, you often waste more materials discovering recipes, rather than actually crafting anything useful.The quests didn't get my attention at all.I saw tons of tombstones (other dead players apparently), but the game isn't 'that' challanging, one of my friends claimed to see a tombstone with my name on it - no idea whats going on there.The UI is fairly weak and clunky (is this ported from an app store/console?).Couldn't get anyone into co-op successfully, even with ports wide open.The "Kill" function seems a bit tempermental, whether you caught it popup or not.The maps aren't really that big to justify exploration.Not like the graphics are bad or there were any crashes, but the game kinda "drones on", there's no sparkle or anythingMaybe I've been gaming too long, or maybe not. This game puts me to sleep, I'm glad I bought it on a mega-sale, it's really not worth £10.99.

												Mediocre gameplay cripples this top down zombie island survival story. Story is intriguing enough to put 5 or so hours into and the crafting is satisfying in a small way. However, the fetch quests which propel the story make you feel like you are not getting anywhere and there is no real reward for completing them. You craft everything, there is no loot, no rewards for quests. The leveling is pointless and time spent killing things seems meaningless.I never finished the game, the final fetch quest of looking for 20 items spread across the islands I have already been with no new weapons in sight left me no longer wanting to play. Fine for the 3 bucks I payed for it. But nothing stellar in this game.

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												I bought this game during the sumer sale for $1.49.    I still considered geting the refund, but for a buck and a half I'd just assume not go through a refund headache.  This game was ported from a console, and POORLY.  For a game that includes a book every 200ft that acts as a tutorial..  You would think they would take the time to update that tutorial for PC's once they uploaded it onto steam, but NOPE.. They are still instructing you on how to use your non-existant double joysticks and when to press A, even though the mouse and F button work (just not too good at attacking in 1 direction while moving another).  The poor porting job is only the beginning though.The gameplay is BORING.  Really Boring.  Hitch your leash to the auto bus and follow the path of the game.. learn the lame crafting you can only do where they want you to do it and kill the same zombies over and over with boring weapons.  I made myself play it for a couple hours hoping it would get better.  Honestly I can't see myself getting bored enough to give it a second chance.. with 60 games in my library, something will always sound more fun than this..  Heck I think I would have more fun reading a good book.The cheesy voice acting Of Kovak was the only part I kind of found enjoyable, and when you hear that overdone thick Russian accent trying to be funny, you will know how sad it is that the poorly ported tutorial that teaches you incorrect info is the "best part".

content:
Posted: January 16, 2015
												Honestly speaking, each and every mother should give this game to their son. This game doesn't only brings out the basic joy of "pretenting" to survive in front of your keyboards, it teaches some very fundamental yet essential skills for surviving at home, especially when you are the type who likes to lock yourself up and game 48 hours each day,First of all, this game equips you with the skill of item organization. Look around you. No, I don't mean look around your monitor, but around the place you are currently sitting in. Do you see piles of clothes, files, items stacked all around you? If no, then good for you. But if you do, and when you do, this games can teach you the skill to organize these "Mount Fabrics" and "Mount Rubble" around you. If you have ventured around for a couple of hours in this game, you would have known that there is no item chest. That's okay, because whenever you dump an item onto the ground, it will stay there, forever. So, when you've collected, let say, a hundred different items (you can easily acheive this number after somewhat 5 hours of gaming), you will find yourself staring at piles and piles of save-it-for-later items, which the later usually mean never. Therefore, when you decide to craft an item (item crafting is one of the selling points of this game), you will need to dig these piles of save-it-for-later to find what you want. You will soon learn to locate burried items, as well as organizing items so that things looks asthetically pleasant and they can be easily located.Item location is not the only skill you learn, as you will be learning the basic functions of the human body. One thing you will notice is that you sleep when you need, and not at night. Well, to be honest, your biological clock doesn't exactly run on a 24 hour scale, at least not in "How to Survive". You will be sleeping during the day, at night, whenever you need, period. Another thing about your body is that, although you need to eat, you never poop. Yes, your body is amazing, because it is all input and there will be no physical residues for output. Everything will be transformed into energy. Think of it like poop is your fuel. So, the keyboard warriors reading this, you felt ashamed that your level is not high enough to unlock this ability of poop-fuel? Me neither. The last thing about your body you should know is that, although you need to cook whatever you eat, you don't have to boil your water. Why? Because you are immune to those zombie infections, dummy! You are the chosen one!There are many more bedroom survival skills for you to figure out, so when you are done slacking around, jump right in and start learning how to survive in your own darn room!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												Basic InformationTitle: How to SurviveGenres: Action, Casual & Indie, A real GemDeveloper: According to the store page, no one has developed this game…Publisher: According to the store page, no one has published this game…Release Date: The 25th of March, 2016General ImpressionHow to Survive… oh my God… why is this on Steam? It should be a browser open-source game. Even the store page of it is not complete, proving that the developer and the publisher don’t even take care of their own game. Where should I start… The graphics are extremely weak, without any polish or additional design. The textures are very simple, and nothing spectacular. The atmosphere differs between 6 different environments. What differs at them: First of all, the type of enemies and the final bosses. Second of all, the color of the background. The audio is somewhat decent, hence they sound like this game is old… and the music… some people might like it, but I personally don’t. The gameplay is boring as hell, you need to shoot and to dodge a ton of enemies, which die from 1 shot, which are coming down constantly, and you will die a lot. After a while, on each map, you will have to kill the final boss. Throughout the maps, you will find several bonus items, which will make your killing time slightly easier. The game is very short, but if you will die a lot, you will need a few hours to complete it, since you will be respawned from the first damn map… why not just respawn from the last map you got into? The game takes around 8 minutes, as I saw on YouTube, if you don’t die even once. So basically, a VERY, VERY, VERY short game. There isn’t any interface at all, all you have to do is click the button to launch the maps or exit. The controls are very simple, you need to use just your mouse. The engines are alright, I haven’t found any haven’t met any bugs, crashes, screen freezes or frame drops. The mechanics are very simple and somewhat neat, hence the moving of your airplane feels a little buggy. Overall, I can’t recommend this game, not even if it was free. Avoid it at all costs, unless you want a game where you need to keep spawning from the 0 point just to finish a 8 minutes game. Very positive reviews? Ha, ha, ha, ha, ha...Combined environments and enemiesBonus item throughout your wayDecent audioSimple controlsSome decent enginesSome decent mechanicsSteam achievements and trading cards availableNeutral PointsThe airplane's mechanics feel a little buggyNegative PointsThe graphics and the textures are too simple and weakThe music is pretty horrible, hence some people like itVery repetitive gameplay, all you have to do is to shoot the enemies and to reach the final destinationThe user-interface is almost not existingThe length of the game is VERY, VERY, VERY shortYou have to spawn from the 0 point if you die, you should respawn from the last mapThe game is treated very superficially by the developers and the publishersThe enemies die from 1 shot and there is too many of them... really?For the amount of content and the time needed to finish it, even 0.99$ is still somewhat highPositive PointsGeneral RatingsFeature	RatingGraphics	39/100Atmosphere	42/100Audio	38/100Music	39/100Gameplay	15/100Story	N/AContent Quality	24/100Content Quantity	20/100User Interface	25/100Controls	64/100Engines	51/100Mechanics	28/100Price Tag	50/100Personal Rating	27/100

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 22, 2015
												*NOTE*- If you want a summary head to the bottom. It also includes a rating       This game seems to be a hit or miss for some people and for me personally I enjoy playing it (Solo, multiplayer is encouraged with friends!!). I don't think that $15 price tag is worth it (picked it up for $3 with all dlc), maybe $10 would be more suitable and if I dare say lower. The game isn't ugly at all, graphics are actually really pleasant and has nice fx. The weather system is also nice along with the Day and Night cycle. Zombies can get fustrating, not dying after a clear blow was delivered and going on to wrek you... Funny glitches do appear but none that would ruin the experience of the game. Zombie ragdolls that expand upon death and then fly away like a balloon that was just released is what I mean. Other than that, glitches are really non-existent.      The core mechanics of the game are really fun however don't get the game thinking other people are going to be on multiplayer unless you get your buddy to pick it up or connect a controller to your computer. The mulitplayer can get fustrating for a couple of reasons such as you and your partner can't drift too far away from one another and there isn't a typing or chatting button if you're playing with someone random. DLC is encouraged (not the skin packs or character addon, but if you want them go ahead). There is a DLC that adds a challenge to the game, without it you can beat the game with a 3 bladed boomerang w/philosopher stone upgrades on them. I'm missing on a lot of things but I just wanted to cover things I thought were worth noting, if I didn't mention anything it was probably because there was a lot to do in that area, it was a good area or thing they did correct, or there was way too much to talk about.OVERALL:The game is good, mechanics are good (Hunger, Thirst, Resting, etc.) along with there being a lot of things you can craft. Zombies after awhile become a chore more-so than an enemy to reckon with unless you're securing a safe spot. The game requires some thinking and searching which is nice, adding to the exploration. H2S is fairly short, I beat it in about 16-17 hours and now I'm going onto the Devil Islands DLC and then doing the Challenge Mode with my friend. At some points the game may get stale and repetative aswell so that is why the DLC is reccomended in my opinion. RATING: 8/10

												Didn't hear about this game until a couple days before release, but I'm glad I did!If you're looking for a good co-op zombie game, this is definitely worth a look. The story isn't much to brag about, but it really doesn't matter as the gameplay alone is top notch. A surprisingly deep crafting system and fun armor customizing, together with local co-op is what makes this game worth your time. Lots of small details adds to the survival quality, such as the need to find food, water and shelters scattered around the maps to refill the hunger, thirst and tiredness bars.In my opinion it's definitely worth the current price of 13,99€, even though it's not that long of a game.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
												This game would have been very satisfying to play if melee was viable after the first few islands.Instead, it becomes a strategy game in which players must counter the nature of the zombies with their weapons. Any other weapon becomes obsolete when dealing with these special zombies.Volcanologist Zeds => Electric GunElectrocuted Zeds => Lots of kiting and bullets, and hoping they don't revive each otherAfter a while, it becomes exhausting to play, and the frustration from not being able to switch weapons fast enough in co-op and dying to zeds is unbearable. Finally, the camera in online multiplayer doesn't make any sense. It's not local co-op, why can't we have separate screens?The game does have very satisfying melee combat for the short time that it was viable though. The frequent finishing moves makes the player feel powerful.

												This game is awesome.It's a survival diablo-esque game, where you hack, slash, loot, but also have to craft everything from nothing but scavenging, have to eat, drink, sleep, tend to yourself...It can be tense but overall it's quite easy in normal mode, but the harder modes deserve their names and it's really good.The gameplay between characters does not differ much, but the characters are unique enough to warrant a bit of freshness when beginning a new one.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2015
												Price purchased to recommend: $4.00Lowest price as of this review: $1.49 (Full collectors with all DLC) Worth it: Yes, for around/under $4.00Pros: Lots of "stuff", IE: items are all over the game world leading to the end of the world, with zombies feel. Plays like an ARPG of old, Titan Quest comes to mind, gritty feel, good game foundation, fun and wild crafting system. Cons: Story, so meh we'll move on already. The crafting is what you DO NOT do to survive. The game ramps up quickly; ran into a few uber mini-bosses for no real reason, other than the game wanted to make it harder? Talking huge beast men a solid 15 feet tallk, um okay? It also gets repetitive, FAST: you'll see barriers that you will be able to blow up after 5-8 hours of adventures, going back to within 100 feet of where you first start. Overall: If you can get this for under $4.00, enjoy the old school / indie feel of games like Titan Quest, Crusader and PoE in regards to ARPG with a wild island/zombie feel; go for it!!

content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												Before we get started I have to make something clear, H2S is not a bad game. It is only sub-par. When playing this game I'll admit I did have some fun, I did enjoy it at some parts of the story, but is it a good title to have in your library? No. It runs fine with minimal to no glitches, the actual gameplay feels tight enough and well put together. HOWEVER, in the end was left with a sour taste in my mouth from all the grinding and repetitive, redundant fetch quests and zombie killing, whenever I see it in my library I cringe just a little on the inside because I could have spent my money on better.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 18, 2014
												Could've been a good game, but has some balance issues and some poor mechanics to control the player.The 'endless supply of night terror zombie things' would be bearable if the player could sleep at will (in  a safe house) to advance time in the game world. Since you can't they are just obnoxious.The infected animals, deer/elk specifically are horribly unbalanced and if they combo you into anything you're pretty much dead, as their 'turn around and charge again' time is faster than your recovery time from being knocked down, this leads to an infinite combo of ♥♥♥♥ you.  This wouldn't be as bad if the game weren't locked into a silly isometric view with no manual camera zoom or angle controls.  Instead, you are usually surprised by one of these guys and half of the time you don't even get a chance to fight back.The lack of names on recipe components is annoying.  HERE R PIKSHURES.Infinite respawning zombies in areas you just cleared is really annoying too.With some simple polish this could've easily been an 8/10 game, instead it gets a 5/10.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												I wasn't exactly surprised by this game, but its not terrible by any means either. I felt that the crafting system wasn't as robust as I would have liked, neither the leveling system nor the inventory space. I constantly kept seeing Inventory Full. I'm not saying that having an inventory restriction is a bad thing in most games, I just felt that particularly for this game, it felt as if it broke up the game play constantly by having to empty out the unwanteds. The downfall of this game I felt was how slow your character moves. The sprinting function was a joke (maybe one second of sprint before it has to recharge) and thus made the game drag on and on and on. I actually didn't complete How to Survive because of the fact that I hit a mission where I needed to go back through all the islands and pick up 20 different packages. I got so frustrated at how long it was taking that it was to much. Normally I would give a game that wasn't my cup of a tea a recommend at a sale price, but I cant really recommend this game solely on the fact that I felt that it was just boring.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
												I don't really care for the game. The gameplay is okay. The controls are really good and every thing flows real smoothly. The crafting is a lot of fun. Making your own weapons never gets stale. The story is your generic zombie survivor story. The main part of the game that prevents me from putting in more time is the camera angle. The way you view the game is in an isometric view.  I for one hate isometric games. The only reason i got the game was the game and all DLC were on sale in one collection. If its the type of game for you then by all means pick it up. The little time I had played it i had fun. But it was ultimitely the isometric camera angle that turned me off. At some point I might try to play it again and then maybe my review on it will change. But for now I'm gonna say no and leave it collecting dust in my gaming library.

content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												So boring..This review could change, if I ever get the energy to bother wasting anymore hours into this game.It's just so easy, a complete cakewall. And so boring. Luckily it's cheap!The gameplay elements consist of just whacking the zombies and moving back, pretty simple. At night some weird looking monsters come out which are scared of light, and not at all a problem if I'm honest. It's just utter♥♥♥♥♥♥ I believe I played for around an hour and decided that was enough.And for some reason there are tons of gravestones around the game, these mark the deaths of other people online who have died. I'm just very confused at how anyone manages to die in this game.One other thing.. Kovac's Rules. ♥♥♥♥ that guy is annoying, I watched the clips because I needed to know how to play the game, but his voice is unbearable. Along with his attempt at wit. The graphics for the tutorial videos are nice though.Overall pros & cons:Pros:- Didn't cost me too much (sale)- Controls work perfectlyCons:- Generally boring- Too easy- Horrible voices (Not just Kovac)- Not really a survival gametl;dr;I think this game sucks because it's boring & too easy. So happy I didn't buy the full edition with all the DLC.

												An Inferior Don't Starve on every point:_ No real sandbox element, more like a zombie survival/ solo campaign hybrid._ Story is pathetically bad (think Doom 3, except even worse: Scientists experiments failed...)._ Horrible atmosphere (music, sound, everything sounds low budget)._ Extremely linear worlds (fill objective, change map, gg wp)._ Questionnable Collisions Boxes (get stuck by a wall of zombies happens)_Tedious Monkey games (most of the time the reward isn't even worth it).I wouldn't recommend this game to anybody - Except people with horrible tastes.4/10

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 17, 2014
												Single player this game is very fun.  Unfortunately I bought it to play multiplayer and, to be honest, it kind of sucks in this mode for a number of reasons:1) You have to share a screen so if you don't stay next to each other then you get very limited vision,2) There is no way of turning off friendly fire.  If you fight next to each other you can do more damage to wach other than the zombies, this is especially annoying when coupled with point 1.3) There is no way of seeing who the other person is aiming (ranged weapon) at, meaning it is easy to walk into the path of fire and get shot in the back by your mate.  It also makes it very easy to waste ammo.4) Quest rewards seem to automatically go to player 1 (and player 2 doesn't get them).  If this is a better weapon it can leave player 2 pretty ineffectual until they manage to get one - which may take some time.5) On a similar note to point 4, the number of items or zombies found are not increased with more players.  I felt this made the game seem unnecessarily competitive.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Constant issues with co op play.  Like locking up every few minutes and having to restart the check point.  It gets old and after about 3 hours the game is now going on the shelf until the next update.  Not enough resources in game for co-op play, unable to switch between melee and ranged weapons without going into inventory. Lots of great ideas but with execution failing this is clearly still in beta.  I did not think I had bought an early access game, it doesn't say i bought an early access game but it has issues like one.Still, I hope they finish the game at some point and iron out the bugs, my gal and I would really like to keep playing.  However at this point the lock ups and restarts are taking the fun out of it.

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2013
												With the buggiest, crashiest starts of any game I've played all year, and some of the worst pacing and difficulty around, How To Survive is most certainly a waste of your time.  Having to disable the game's entire movies folder in order to make it run is a common problem people have, which will stop you from even getting past the main menu.  Once you're actually in the game, it's a bland and failed clone of Diablo-style gameplay, with the only challenge being not falling asleep as you one-shot every enemy that comes your way, while using the weakest character in the game, with the first real weapon the game gives you about five minutes in.  Half an hour later, I had upgraded to even stronger weapons, to the point where even though the game tried to introduce a new enemy, I still one-shotted it without even charging up my attacks.  Utter rubbish.  Do not buy.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												No, unless it's on sale again for 3 bucks, just no. It looked kinda cool, and starting off it was. Finding all the "rules" of survival and slowly getting introduced to it, it was all well and fun. I also liked the fact that it was just normal zombies at first, with the exception of occasional bloater type fat guys, but that didn't last long either. Zombie crabs are annoying as crap. The zombie deer is more dangerous than anything apparently. 20 arrows sticking out of its skull and it's still charging around. These controls just aren't made for that kind of action. -_-It's set up to be a good game, it really is, but it just didn't quite make it. Like most of the other games on the market, it's unfinished, and had its balls chopped off to be sold later as DLC. That's something I can't support. Not to mention that when I got through what felt like the introduction tutorial, I was already 48% done with the Story Mode .... Just about an hour or so of gameplay in the Story Mode and now I'm at 68%. I was really hoping for a bigger game, or at least an open ended kind of mode, but no ... apparently that's DLC. Go figure.The only positive thing I have to say about this game is that yes, it does feel fun to play, considering the poor aiming ability with a bow. It COULD have been a really great game, the "surviving" part isn't too tedius but it's there enough to be considered, but the game is just wayyyyyy too small. So yeah, another♥♥♥♥♥♥poor game that didn't get finished and I wasted a few bucks. Never buy anything unless its 80% anymore for that very reason.
